alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 7:48PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Ogeechee River at GA 88 near Grange affecting Jefferson and Washington Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ogeechee River at GA 88 near Grange. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 88. The water level will cover around three fourths of the Sandy Ford Public Boat Ramp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 12/16/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
